data.title: Dolby Surround Sound Audio Discography
data.meta_description: Dolby Surround Audio Discography, Dolby Surround Audio recordings on Compact Disc
data.text:
Dolby Surround Audio Discography-Soundtracks & Original Cast Recordings

1. List compiled & Copyright by: Mark Anderson 2. All listings are compact disc format unless noted otherwise. 3. All listings are U.S. releases unless noted otherwise. 4. All listings are Dolby Surround encoded unless noted otherwise. 5. Updates, corrections or changes from previous version are indicated by a asterisk (*). 6. Abbreviations : DS - Dolby Surround Encoded CD DNS - DTS Neural Surround CD HTS - Shure Home Theater Surround Encoded CD **LP - Vinyl Phonograph Record **MC - Music Cassette NS - Natural Surround. Microphone Technique for Dolby Surround Playback SP - Spatializer Enhanced for Surround Playback CD A ACOUSTIC UNIT - * Acoustic Unit. LMP 7243 8 85570 2 3 {Only track 5 is Dolby Surround} ALEX PARTY - Alex Party. TR-CD 5000 (DS) [Netherlands] Radio Broadcasts - The first dolby surround mixed radio drama from YLE Radio in Finland was transmitted on channel 1, Ylen Ykkonen on the 9th of March at 14.00. Then rebroadcast on the following day 10th of March at 19.30. Name of the play is Ihminen kivena (A man as a stone) author Juha Vakkuri, director Mikael Sievers, sound Ari Mursula. - Thomas Mann: The Magic Mountain (Der Zauberberg,German) (Taikavuori, Finnish) Directed and dramatized by Outi Nyytaja Transmitted on "Radio Ylen Ykkonen" (Channel 1 of the Finnish Broadcasting Company) in Dolby Surround Part 1: "Arrival", March 1st 1998 (repeated 2nd), duration 64' Part 2: "Fever Thermometer", March 8th 1998 (rep. 9th), dur. 59'15" Part 3: "The Carnival", March 15th 1998 (rep. 16th), dur. 61'40" Part 4: "Death of a Hero", March 22nd 1998 (rep. 23rd), dur. 71' Part 5: "Peeperkorn", March 29th 1998 (rep. 30th), dur. 72' ------------------------------------------ - The fifth series of "Dangerfield" a police-doctor drama, which starts this autumn on the BBC, will be broadcast in full Dolby Surround. There is no Dolby logo on the opening credits, although it has been widely reported in the U.K. press that the programme is in Dolby Surround where Nicam stereo is available. (Nicam stereo is the method used for transmitting 2 channel digital audio in europe) - BBC Radio 4 broadcasted their first Dolby Surround drama on the 18 of February 1995. The play was called "Bomber", a dramatization of a Len Deighton novel. Before that BBC Radio 1 had broadcast a number of productions in the same format, Batman, Knightfall and the Adventures of the Superman. So these must have been in 1994. The BBC Radio 1 programs were not advertised as Dolby Surround. This is partly because of the BBC politics not to advertise a commercial product and maybe partly because they wanted to test if using the system will cause any complaints from regular listeners. - BBC Radio broadcast "Superman" the series in '94. It was broadcast in Dolby Surround. This may not have been a BBC produced project.
